title: rallicagram
text: gallicagram_associated builds data frame words frequently used close (specified distance) given keyword period. function calls associated route API. keyword can 2-gram “books” “press” corpora 3-gram “lemonde” corpus. length keyword plus distance 3 “books” “press” corpora 4 “lemonde” corpus. Searching “press” corpus can take long time. terms often associated “camarade” : default, frequent words Gallica books corpus removed. Instead, can remove stopwords, supplying list words ignore stopwords parameter function. instance, can use list lsa package, lsa::stopwords_fr. keep stopwwords, set stopwords parameter NULL. often associated terms without excluding stopwords :

title: rallicagram
text: order run functions several keywords , can use function purrr::map_dfr. takes parameters vector keywords search, followed function (gallicagram) additional arguments pass function. returns unique data frame results searches corresponding keyword, basically binding dataframes produced keyword search. Based principle, can run several searches , varying parameters, keyword searched. , can specify series parameters data frame, row corresponding set parameters run gallicagram function . pass data frame purrr::pmap_dfr. specify set parameters, can either build parameters data frame hand. also often helpful use tidyr::crossing create combination possible searches. corresponding set parameters search looks like : can pass purrr::pmap_dfr call function gallicagram 4 sets parameters defined rows params_pmap: method also apply functions rallicagram package.
code: library(purrr)  keywords <- c("république", "france")  purrr::map_dfr(keywords, gallicagram,                corpus = "lemonde", from = "1960", to = "1970") params_pmap <-   tibble::tibble(     from = 1850,     to = 1870,     resolution = "yearly"   ) |>   tidyr::crossing(corpus = c("press", "books")) |>   tidyr::crossing(keyword = c("république", "france")) purrr::pmap_dfr(params_pmap, gallicagram)

title: rallicagram
text: One main usage Gallicagram plot time series occurrences corpus. example graph using ggplot (ggplot theme mediocrethemes. use theme course mandatory one can remove line mediocrethemes::set_mediocre_all()):  can use geom_smooth plot smoother lines. using default loess smoothing, parameter span controls amount smoothing. Larger values associated less smoothing. graph smoothed:
code: library(ggplot2) mediocrethemes::set_mediocre_all()  ex_data <- gallicagram(   keyword = "informatique",   corpus = "lemonde",   from = 1945,   to = 2022,   resolution = "yearly" )  ex_data |>   ggplot(aes(x = date, y = prop_occur)) +   geom_line() +   labs(     title = "Evolution of occurrences of 'computering' (informatique)",     subtitle = "In the french newspaper Le Monde",     x = NULL,     y = "Proportion of occurrences"   ) ex_data |>   ggplot(aes(x = date, y = prop_occur)) +   geom_smooth(span = 0.2) +   labs(     title = "Evolution of occurrences of 'computering' (informatique)",     subtitle = "In the french newspaper Le Monde",     x = NULL,     y = "Proportion of occurrences"   ) #> `geom_smooth()` using method = 'loess' and formula = 'y ~ x'

title: Words the most often associated with a keyword in a Gallicagram corpus — gallicagram_associated
text: functions calls 'associated' route API. function available three main corpora (historical press, Gallica books, Le Monde newspaper). Note API route allow search associated words punctuation mark. instance, "son camarade, le chasseur, ", function count "chasseur" word associated "camarade". ngram "son camarade le chasseur" database. Thus, might less associated words longer distance increases probability ngrams excluded database. Apostrophes letters preceding withdrawn dataset (except n' since carry meaning) Searching "press" corpus can require long running time.
